metadata.description:
"I had a dream that I died in my sleep, and my heroes were singing my songs" 

btw, 100 editions of this song absolutely terrifies me. But the thing is, I wanted to allow the most collectors into my funeral as possible.. I want this release to be a party!! But a reflective, in depth, life-is-short kind of party.. I hope this song makes you feel and makes you think... What is it you truly want to leave behind? What is a legacy? Who is there, at your funeral? 

Sometimes I get caught up in a lot of the insignificant pieces of life, I think maybe we all do? But what I truly want most out of my life is big funeral at the end of it, with weed and whiskey. Fine, and I also want Marcus Mumford and Brandi Carlile to duet one of my songs.
;)

BIG FUNERAL
written/produced by : 
Kathleen Regan & Kid Elliot
artwork by :
Interrobang 


PS. can you spot some of my fave artists / influences in the artwork?

lyrics.text:
I HAD A DREAM 
THAT I DIED IN MY SLEEP
AND MY HEROES WERE SINGING MY SONGS 

SHE HELD ONTO ME,
AS I WATCHED AND I WEEPED 
AT EVERYONE SINGING ALONG 


ITS UNUSUAL 
TO SAY THIS OUT LOUD
BUT I REALLY HOPE IT COMES TRUE 

CUZ IT WOULD BE BEAUTIFUL
AND MAKE ME SO PROUD 
I JUST HOPE IT DON'T HAPPEN 
TOO SOON

BUT I HOPE IT COMES TRUE 


WHEN I ARRIVE 
10 MINUTES BEHIND
THEY’LL BE A LINE OUT THE DOOR 
THEY’LL ALL CELEBRATE
AND GET DRUNK IN MY NAME
THAT'S WHAT A BIG FUNERALS FOR 

ITS UNUSUAL 
TO SAY THIS OUT LOUD
BUT I REALLY HOPE IT COMES TRUE 

CUZ IT WOULD BE BEAUTIFUL
AND MAKE ME SO PROUD 
I JUST HOPE IT DON'T HAPPEN 
TOO SOON
BUT I HOPE IT COMES TRUE 


I HAVE A FEAR
THAT I’M JUST LAYING THERE
AND THEY CHOSE A BAD PICTURE OF ME
BUT I HAVEN'T DIED
I STILL HAVE TIME
TO BE WHO I'M TRYING TO BE

metadata.name: Big Funeral #1
metadata.title: Big Funeral
